document.docAuthor: Godeiro, Nerivania N. & Bellini, Bruno C.
document.docTitle: Seira jiboiensis Godeiro & Bellini, 2014, sp. nov.
document.masterDocTitle: Three new species of Seira Lubbock (Collembola, Entomobryidae) from Caatinga Domain, northeastern Brazil

mods:titleInfo.mods:title: Three new species of Seira Lubbock (Collembola, Entomobryidae) from Caatinga Domain, northeastern Brazil

subSubSection.paragraph:
Type Material.
Holotype male, Brazil , Bahia, Santa Terezinha, Serra da Jib√≥ia,
07.xi. 2010
(
Fig. 1
). Bellini, B.C. col. Paratypes
1 male
, same data as Holotype . Type material deposited at Collembola Collection of DBEZ / UFRN .

Description. Total body length of holotype 1.25 mm . Habitus entomobryid (
Fig. 2
A). Colour of mounted specimens pale yellow, with two unpaired dark blue spots on head and paired ones on posterolateral margin of Abd. III (
Fig. 2
A), eye patches black. Rounded brownish scales covering Ant. I and II, basal half of Ant. III and IV, head, thorax, abdomen, legs, manubrium (dorsally) and dentes (ventrally). Ventral tube without scales. Ant. IV not annulated, with a single apical bulb, several multiciliated setae, some small smooth setae and some blunt s-setae (
Fig. 2
B). Eye patches oval with 8 + 8 lenses; ‚ÄòA‚Äô and ‚ÄòB‚Äô lenses largest and G smallest (
Fig. 2
C). Five interocular multiciliated setae, ‚Äòp‚Äô as macrochaeta, ‚Äòq‚Äô, ‚Äòr‚Äô, ‚Äòs‚Äô and ‚Äòt‚Äô as mesochaetae (
Fig. 2
C). Pre-labral and labral setae smooth. Labial triangle setae ‚ÄòM 1 ‚Äô, ‚ÄòM 2 ‚Äô and ‚ÄòE‚Äô multiciliated, ‚Äòr‚Äô apparently smooth, reduced (
Fig. 2
D), ‚ÄòL 1 ‚Äô, ‚ÄòL 2 ‚Äô multicilated (not drawn). Metatrochanteral organ with approximately 16 short spines (
Fig. 2
E). All ungues with four teeth, two subequal basal paired teeth and two internal, apical unpaired, the internal row with different relative distances from each other between the three legs (
Figs. 2
F-H). Unguiculi lanceolate with slightly serrated posterior edges (
Figs. 2
F-H). Tenent hair capitate with weakly serrated edges. Ventral manubrium with 4 + 4 subapical setae, spines typically absent on furcula. Mucro typically falcate (
Fig.
2
I).

caption.paragraph: FIGURE 1. Map of Brazil showing Federal States of northeastern region. The grey area indicates the municipalities where the species were collected.

subSubSection.paragraph:
Dorsal head chaetotaxy. ‚ÄòAn‚Äô series with 7 + 7 macrochaetae; one super-numerary microseta between An 1 and An 2 ; ‚ÄòA‚Äô series with A 4 present; A0, A 2 , A 3 and A 5 as macrochaetae; A 1 and A 4 as microsetae; ‚ÄòM‚Äô series with 4 + 4 setae; M 1 absent; M 2 and M 4 as macrochaetae; M 3 and M
4 i
as microsetae; ‚ÄôS‚Äô series with S 4 absent; S0, S 2 , S 3 and S 6 as macrochaetae; S 5 and a super-numerary seta near S 6 as microseta; Interocular series with 5 + 5 setae; p as macrochaeta; q, r, s t as mesosetae; ‚ÄòPs‚Äô series with 3 + 3 microsetae; Ps 4 absent (typical of
Seira ,
see Soto- Adames 2008 ); ‚ÄòPa‚Äô series with 7 + 7 setae; Pa 1 and a super-numerary seta near Pa 4 as microseta; Pa 2 , Pa 3 , Pa 4 and Pa 5 as macrochaeta and Pa 6 as post ocular trichobothrium; ‚ÄòPm‚Äô series with 2 + 2 setae, Pm 2 absent (typical of
Seira ,
see Soto-Adames 2008 ); Pm 1 as microseta and Pm 3 as macrochaeta; ‚ÄòPp‚Äô series with 4 + 4 setae; Pp 4 absent; Pp 3 as macrochaeta; Pp 1 , Pp 2 and Pp 5 as microsetae (
Fig. 3
).

Dorsal mesothorax chaetotaxy. ‚Äòa‚Äô series (without anterior setal collar) with 7 + 7 setae; a 2 p as microseta; a
5 i
2 , a
5 i
2 p, a 5 ip, a
5 i
, a 5 , a 5 p as macrochaetae; ‚Äòm‚Äô series with 12 + 12 setae; m
1 i
3 , m
2 i
2 absent; m
1 i
2 , m
1 i
, m 4 ip, m 5 a, m 5 , m 5 p and a super-numerary seta near m 5 as microsetae (m 5 e?); m
2 i
, m 1 , m 2 , m
4 i
, m 4 p, m 4 as macrochaetae; m 5 p distant from other ‚Äòm‚Äô series setae, near ‚Äòp‚Äô series (see Soto-Adames 2008 ); ‚Äòp‚Äô series with 15 + 15 to 16 + 16 setae; p 2 ea and p 4 absent; p
1 i
2 , p
1 i
, p 1 , p 1 ip, p 1 p, p 2 a, p 2 , p 2 p, p 2 e, p 2 ep, p 3 p, p 3 and p 5 as macrochaetae; p
1 i
2 p, p 6 , p 6 e as microseta; p
1 i
2 p absent in one specimen; three super-numerary macrochaetae near p 6 (not drawn‚Äìsee Soto-Adames 2008 ) (
Fig. 4
A).

Dorsal metathorax chaetotaxy. ‚Äòa‚Äô series with 7 + 7 setae; a 1 a absent; a 3 , a 6 and a 7 as microsetae; a 1 , a 2 , a 4 and a 5 as macrochaetae; ‚Äòm‚Äô series with 6 + 6 setae; m 1 absent; m
1 i
and m 6 as macrochaetae; m 4 , m 5 and m 7 as microsetae; m 6 p as mesochaeta; ‚Äòp‚Äô series with 9 + 9 setae; p
1 i
absent; p 2 ea, p 4 , p 5 , p 6 as microsetae; p 1 , p 2 , p 2 a, p 2 e and p 3 as macrochaetae; accessory seta present near m 7 (
Fig. 4
B).

Dorsal Abd. I chaetotaxy. ‚Äòa‚Äô series with 7 + 7 setae; a 4 absent; a 1 , a 1 a, a 1 e, a 2 , a 3 and a 6 as microsetae; a 5 as macrochaetae; accessory seta present near a 6 ; ‚Äòm‚Äô series with 5 + 5 setae; m 6 absent; m 5 as microsetae; m 2 , m 3 , m 4 and m
4 i
as macrochaetae; ‚Äòp‚Äô series with 2 + 2 microsetae (p 5 and p 6 ) (
Fig. 4
C).

caption.paragraph:
FIGURE 2.
Seira jiboiensis
sp. nov.
: A, habitus; B, apical region of Ant. IV; C, left eye patch; D, labial triangle setae (left side); E, Metatrochanteral organ; F, first empodial complex; G, second empodial complex; H, third empodial complex; I, distal dens and mucro. Large empty circles refer to macrochaetae; half white half black large circles to mesochaetae; small black circles to microsetae; large empty circles with a small black circle inside to micro or macrochaetae; large black circles with a small cross line to pseudopores; long multiciliated setae to trichobothria; triangle like setae near trichobothria to fan-shaped scales; small black pointed setae to accessory setae (more details in Soto-Adames 2008).

subSubSection.paragraph:
Dorsal Abd. II chaetotaxy. ‚Äòa‚Äô series with 6 + 6 setae; a 2 p absent; a 3 , as, a 6 and a 7 as microsetae; a 2 as macrochaetae; a 5 as trichobothrium with 5 surrounding fan shaped scales; ‚Äòm‚Äô series with 7 + 7 setae; m 3 ep and m 3 ea absent; m
3 ei
, m 6 and m 7 as microsetae; m 3 , m 3 e and m 5 as macrochaetae; m 2 as trichobothrium with 3 surrounding fan shaped scales; ‚Äòp‚Äô series with 3 + 3 setae; p 5 , p 6 and p 7 as microsetae; el and se present as microsetae (
Fig. 4
D).

caption.paragraph:
FIGURE 3. Detailed dorsal head chaetotaxy of
Seira jiboiensis
sp. nov.
Symbols as for Figure 2.

subSubSection.paragraph:
Dorsal Abd. III chaetotaxy. ‚Äòa‚Äô series with 7 + 7 setae; a 7 absent; as, a 3 and a 6 as microsetae; am 6 as macrochaeta; a 1 and a 2 as fan shaped scales; a 5 as trichobothrium with 5 surrounding fan shaped scales; ‚Äòm‚Äô series with 5 + 5 setae; m 3 ea absent; m 2 as trichobothrium with 5 surrounding fan shaped scales; m 5 as trichobothrium with 3 surrounding fan shaped; m 4 as fan shaped scale, m 7 as microseta; m 3 as macrochaeta; ‚Äòp‚Äô series with 6 + 6 setae; p 3 and p 5 as microsetae; p
7 i
and p 7 as mesochaetae; pm 6 and p 6 as macrochaetae; em, emp and c 3 as fan shaped scales; se as microsetae; d 2 accessory seta present, near p 5 (
Fig. 5
A).

caption.paragraph:
FIGURE 4. Detailed dorsal chaetotaxy of
Seira jiboiensis
sp. nov.
(left side) A. Mesothorax; B. Metathorax; C. Abd. I; D. Abd. II. Symbols as for Figure 2.

FIGURE 5. Detailed dorsal chaetotaxy of
Seira jiboiensis
sp. nov.
A. Abd. III (left side); B. Abd. IV (left side); C. Distribution of dorsal macrochaetae (right side). Symbols as for Figure 2.

subSubSection.paragraph:
Dorsal Abd. IV chaetotaxy. ‚ÄòA‚Äô series with 9 + 9 to 10 + 10 setae; A 1 , A 2 a, A 2 , A 3 a, A 6 , Ae 7 and one supernumerary seta between A 4 and A 5 as microsetae; A 2 a lacking in one specimen; A 3 , A 4 and A 5 as macrochaetae; ‚ÄòB‚Äô series with 6 + 6 setae; B 1 absent; B 2 and one super-numerary seta near B 4 as microsetae; B 3 , B 4 , B 5 and B 6 as macrochaetae; ‚ÄòC‚Äô series with 5 + 5 setae; C 4 a absent; C 1 and C 4 as macrochaetae; C 1 p, C 2 and C 3 as microsetae; ‚ÄòT‚Äô series with 7 + 7 setae; T 1 , T 3 , T 5 and T 6 as microsetae; T 7 as mesochaetae; T 2 and T 4 as trichobothria with 3 fan shaped scales above each of them; ps present as accessory microsetae; ‚ÄòD‚Äô series with 4 + 4 setae; D 1 as fan shaped scale; D 2 a absent; D 2 as microsetae; D 3 as trichobothria without fan shaped scales associated; D 3 p as mesochaeta; ‚ÄòE‚Äô series with 5 + 5 setae; E 1 , E 2 a, E 10 p and E 4 p 2 absent; E 2 , E 2 p and E 3 as macrochaetae; E 4 and E 4 p as microsetae; ‚ÄòF‚Äô series with 6 + 6 macrochaetae; ‚ÄòFe‚Äô series with 5 + 5 macrochaetae plus one super-numerary microseta near Fe 6 ; sequence of nine setae at the end of the segment (
Fig. 5
B).

Distribution of dorsal macrochaetae of whole body as in
Figure 5
C.
Etymology. The species was named after the type locality, Serra da Jib√≥ia.

Remarks.
Seira jiboiensis
sp. nov.
can be clearly distinguished from other neotropical
Seira
species by the combination of the following characteristics: a unique pattern of chaetotaxy on Jacquemart‚Äôs ( 1974 ) cephalic regions 4 B and 6 ; presence of three macrochaetae (m
2 i
, m 1 and m 2 ) on Jacquemart‚Äôs ( 1974 ) region 2 of the mesothorax and the presence of three macrochaetae (p 3 , a 4 and a 5 ) on Jacquemart‚Äôs region C of the metathorax. However, the general configuration of dorsal chaetotaxy of
S. jiboiensis
sp. nov.
shows some similarities with
S. mendoncea
Bellini & Zeppelini 2008 a
and
S. ritae
Bellini & Zeppelini 2011 a
, mainly on the Abd. I, which shows 5 + 5 macrochaetae on the three species (m 2 , m 3 , m
4 i
, m 4 and a 5 ) in the new species, possibly the same in
S. mendoncea
and
S. ritae
.
Seira mendoncea
is also similar to
S. jiboiensis
sp. nov.
in Jacquemart‚Äôs regions 3 A and 3 B of the mesothorax; metathorax regions A and B; region B of Abd. II and region A of Abd. III. These three species also share similarities in other features like the presence of a bilobed apical bulb, presence of labial triangle setae "r" and unguiculi acuminate. A detailed comparison between the cited species of
Seira
is presented in
Tables 2
and
3
. All these features and the near distribution of the three species (presented in the next paragraph) suggest phylogenetic approximation between them.

Seira jiboiensis
sp. nov.
and
S. mendoncea
were collected in humid areas of Caatinga (Serra da Jib√≥ia/BA and Cacimba de Dentro/PB, respectively), whereas
S. ritae
was collected in the Praia do Bessa/PB on sand dunes.
Seira jiboiensis
sp. nov.
was collected during the wet season, in litter and soil samples. The climate of the region according to Koeppen system is type ‚ÄòAs‚Äô, characterised by a peculiar long, dry, summer and a short wet winter (
Kottek et al. 2006
).

caption.paragraph:
TABLE 2. Main morphological characteristics of cited
Seira
species. (A-) minor apical; (M+) larger medial; (+) presence; (-) absence; (+ -) = present but not clearly observed or weakly annulated; LANC = Lanceolate; TRUN = Truncate.

tr.th: Clear annulations on 4th segment of antennae
Modified blunt setae at base of dentes

caption.paragraph:
TABLE 3. Number of dorsal macrochaetae per field (following the system of Jacquemart 1974) for
Seira
species.
